definitions.definition: To overwhelm with bewilderment ; to amaze , confound , or stun , especially in a ludicrous manner.
examples: He was flabbergasted to find that his work had been done for him before he began.
Her stupidity flabbergasts me, and I have to force myself to keep a straight face while she explains her beliefs.
The oddity of the situation was so flabbergasting I couldn’t react in time for anyone to see it.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To overwhelm with bewilderment ; to amaze , confound , or stun , especially in a ludicrous manner. [from late 18th c.]
